user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of check_apply_param__all_cpus:
```c
static void
check_apply_param__all_cpus (void)
{
  if (! tool_params.all_cpus)
    return;

  num_threads = get_process_cpu_core_count ();
  printf ("Requested use of all available CPU cores for MHD threads.\n");
  if (get_cpu_core_count () == num_threads)
    print_all_cores_used ();
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (get_cpu_core_count () == num_threads)
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation given the provided code fragment: check_apply_param__all_cpus() simply calls get_cpu_core_count(). That is not recursion by itself. A violation would occur only if get_cpu_core_count() (or any function it calls) called check_apply_param__all_cpus() (indirect recursion) or if get_cpu_core_count() called itself (direct recursion).
